content.title: Aneurysms in PAN
content.description: Characteristic aneurysm formation in polyarteritis nodosa

key_concepts.details: Mesenteric, renal, hepatic, and splenic arteries most commonly affected
Multiple small (2-10mm) aneurysms at branch points; 'rosary bead' pattern
Spontaneous rupture with retroperitoneal or intraperitoneal hemorrhage
Immunosuppression first-line; embolization for acute hemorrhage; surgery rarely needed

content.clinical_significance: Aneurysm rupture is a major cause of mortality in untreated PAN

primary_sources: Stone JH. Rheum Dis Clin North Am 2017
